org.gridfour.gvrs

Class GvrsElementIntCodedFloat

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.gridfour.gvrs.GvrsElement
      • org.gridfour.gvrs.GvrsElementIntCodedFloat

  • public class GvrsElementIntCodedFloat
extends GvrsElement
    Provides a concrete definition of a GvrsElementSpecification that specifies four-byte floating-point value encoded as an integer.

    • Method Detail

      • readValueInt

        public int readValueInt(int row,
                        int column)
                 throws IOException
        Read the encoded integer value from the GvrsFile. If no data exists for the specified row and column, the fill value will be returned.

        Note: This class is unusual for GVRS because the integer return value for this method is not a simple casting of the floating point value. Rather, this method returns the integer-coded representation of the floating-point value.

        Specified by:
        readValueInt in class GvrsElement
        Parameters:
        row - a positive value in the range defined by the file specifications.
        column - a positive value in the range defined by the file specifications.
        Returns:
        an integer value in the integer-coded-float format.
        Throws:
        IOException - in the event of a non-recoverable I/O exception.

      • writeValueInt

        public void writeValueInt(int row,
                          int column,
                          int value)
                   throws IOException
        Stores an integer value in the GvrsFile; while this method is provided for compatibility with the GvrsElement base class, its use requires special handling.

        Note: This class is unusual for GVRS because the value stored by this method is not a simple equivalent of the floating point value. Rather, this method treats the input integer value as the integer code for an associated floating-point value.

        Specified by:
        writeValueInt in class GvrsElement
        Parameters:
        row - a positive value in the range defined by the file specifications.
        column - a positive value in the range defined by the file specifications.
        value - an integer value in the integer-coded-float format.
        Throws:
        IOException - in the event of a non-recoverable I/O exception.

      • readValue

        public float readValue(int row,
                       int column)
                throws IOException
        Description copied from class: GvrsElement
        Reads a floating-point value from the GVRS raster file. If no data exists for the specified row and column, the fill value will be returned.
        Specified by:
        readValue in class GvrsElement
        Parameters:
        row - a positive value in the range defined by the file specifications.
        column - a positive value in the range defined by the file specifications.
        Returns:
        an floating-point value or the fill value if there is no data stored at the specified row and column
        Throws:
        IOException - in the event of a non-recoverable I/O exception.

      • writeValue

        public void writeValue(int row,
                       int col,
                       float value)
                throws IOException
        Description copied from class: GvrsElement
        Write a floating-point value to the GVRS raster file. Because write operations are buffered, this data may be retained in memory for some time before actually being written to the file. However, any data lingering in memory will be recorded when the flush() or close() methods are called.

        The value Float.NaN is reserved for the representation of null data.

        Specified by:
        writeValue in class GvrsElement
        Parameters:
        row - a positive value in the range defined by the file specifications.
        col - a positive value in the range defined by the file specifications.
        value - an floating-point value.
        Throws:
        IOException - in the event of an unrecoverable I/O exception.

      • readValue

        public float readValue(GridPoint gridPoint)
                throws IOException
        Description copied from class: GvrsElement
        Reads a floating-point value from the GVRS raster file. If no data exists for the coordinates (row and column) specified by the GridPoint instance, the fill value will be returned.
        Specified by:
        readValue in class GvrsElement
        Parameters:
        gridPoint - a valid instance
        Returns:
        an floating-point value or the fill value if there is no data stored at the specified row and column
        Throws:
        IOException - in the event of a non-recoverable I/O exception.

      • writeValue

        public void writeValue(GridPoint gridPoint,
                       float value)
                throws IOException
        Description copied from class: GvrsElement
        Write a floating-point value to the GVRS raster file. Because write operations are buffered, this data may be retained in memory for some time before actually being written to the file. However, any data lingering in memory will be recorded when the flush() or close() methods are called.

        The value Float.NaN is reserved for the representation of null data.

        Specified by:
        writeValue in class GvrsElement
        Parameters:
        gridPoint - a valid instance giving coordinates within the limits of the grid.
        value - an floating-point value.
        Throws:
        IOException - in the event of an unrecoverable I/O exception.

      • writeValueInt

        public void writeValueInt(GridPoint gridPoint,
                          int value)
                   throws IOException
        Description copied from class: GvrsElement
        Write an integer value in the GVRS raster file. Because write operations are buffered, this data may be retained in memory for some time before actually being written to the file. However, any data lingering in memory will be recorded when the flush() or close() methods are called.

        The value GvrsFileConstants.NULL_DATA_CODE is reserved for the representation of null data.

        Specified by:
        writeValueInt in class GvrsElement
        Parameters:
        gridPoint - a valid instance giving coordinates within the dimensions of the grid.
        value - an integer value.
        Throws:
        IOException - in the event of an unrecoverable I/O exception.

      • mapValueToInteger

        public int mapValueToInteger(float value)
        Converts a floating-point value to its associated integer code based on the scale and offset parameters set for this instance.
        Parameters:
        value - a floating point value within the range of values supported by this instance
        Returns:
        if successful, an integer value

      • mapIntegerToValue

        Converts a coded integer to its associated floating-point value based on the scale and offset parameters set for this instance.
        Parameters:
        integerCode - a coded integer value within the range of values supported by this instance
        Returns:
        if successful, an integer value

      • toString

        public String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class GvrsElement

      • getFillValueInt

        public int getFillValueInt()
        Gets the value that is assigned to all raster cells that have not been otherwise populated. Some data sources may treat this value as a "no-data" value while others may treat it as a meaningful default value. The fill value is specified when a GVRS file is first created and may not be modified afterwards.

        The fill value is not required to be within the range specified by the minimum and maximum values.

        Returns:
        an arbitrary integer.

      • getMaxValueInt

        public int getMaxValueInt()
        Gets the maximum value specified for the range of this instance. The maximum value is specified when a GVRS file is first created and may not be modified afterwards.
        Returns:
        an arbitrary integer

      • getMinValueInt

        public int getMinValueInt()
        Gets the minimum value specified for the range of this instance. The minimum value is specified when a GVRS file is first created and may not be modified afterwards.
        Returns:
        an arbitrary integer

      • getMinValue

        public float getMinValue()
        Gets the minimum floating-point value specified for the range of this instance. The minimum value is specified when a GVRS file is first created and may not be modified afterwards.

        The value returned from this method is computed from the minimum integer value, scale, and offset specified for this instance. Due to the limits of numerical precision, it may not be a perfect match for an integral value even in cases where that is expected.

        Returns:
        a computed floating-point value

      • getMaxValue

        public float getMaxValue()
        Gets the maximum floating-point value specified for the range of this instance. The maximum value is specified when a GVRS file is first created and may not be modified afterwards.

        The value returned from this method is computed from the minimum integer value, scale, and offset specified for this instance. Due to the limits of numerical precision, it may not be a perfect match for an integral value even in cases where that is expected.

        Returns:
        a computed floating-point value

      • getFillValue

        public float getFillValue()
        Gets the value that is assigned to all raster cells that have not been otherwise populated. Some data sources may treat this value as a "no-data" value while others may treat it as a meaningful default value. The fill value is specified when a GVRS file is first created and may not be modified afterwards.

        The fill value is not required to be within the range specified by the minimum and maximum values.

        A fill value is allowed to be Float.NAN.

        Returns:
        an arbitrary floating-point value.
